title: Mario Draghi is no ‘saviour’ – history will judge him as reckless and misguided
text:
During his eight years as president of the European Central Bank (ECB), Mario Draghi has shown “conviction”, “great skill” and “brilliance”. At his final press conference last Thursday, he demonstrated, once again, “compelling insight”, “candour” and “courage”.

As he retires, analysts at bulge-bracket financial institutions are heaping praise on the man they call Super Mario. “The most effective monetary policymaker of his generation,” is a phrase I’ve heard from several City economists over recent days. “He saved the European single currency in its darkest hour,” is another.
